', 'name_user': 'Trang NguyÃªn', 'user_id': 50982351, 'comment': [{'comment': 'People love it because it\'s realistic. A good novel doesn\'t always have to have perfect characters. If you want perfect and likeable characters that much, you should read "The Notebook". Yes, Ngáº¡n sounds like a loser, HÃ  Lan must be a utilitarian girl, DÅ©ng is an f-boy. But that\'s why this story could have touched so many people- because it\'s realistic and it\'s relatable. We don\'t need to be gods to love, to hate, to have meaningful memories and bitter experiences. Ngáº¡n, as I said- is just a below-average guy, but his loyal with Ha Lan is a symbol for a type of love that so many people on earth have experienced: the innocent, no self-interest emotions toward your crush, your first love. Sometimes this type of love is harmful to both of the parties, but it\'s love regardless and that\'s why Ngáº¡n\'s emotions toward HÃ  Lan in this novel should be seen with empathy even they are not sensible at all. HÃ  Lan can be observed as a typical beautiful girl who changes her environment from rural to urban. Her life can turn in two directions - either to become independent and to be happy, or it can also be very painful. Nguyá»…n Nháº­t Ãnh made her make a choice and we should not criticise it, but to learn from her decision\'s consequences. Furthermore- About DÅ©ng, I don\'t think he\'s that bad. Yeah, he\'s pretty bad, but in this novel, he represents the guys who are young and have nothing to worry about life and/or financial problems. Guys like that can be carefree, heartless or to be seen by some people as cruel but it\'s a fact of life and there is little thing we can do about it other than protecting and improving ourselves. And lastly, TrÃ  Long- a cute girl with all the good traits, but turns out to be just a copy or someone else\'s replacement. It\'s bitter and it\'s hard to accept, but again it\'s realistic. Trust me, if you dive deep enough into love, someday you may find yourself- or your partner just to be a replacement for a ghost of the past. But I hope that you all won\'t have to live a whole life in that role, and that\'s what Nguyá»…n Nháº­t Ãnh are trying to say with us, by using Ngáº¡n and TrÃ  Long. So, did you see? "Máº¯t biáº¿c" is not a perfect love story, not even a good story. But it\'s a great novel about the love and the life of young Vietnamese people in the 60s (or 70s). The emotions in the novel are real, and I think that not only you and me, or people nowaday but also people in the future can feel related to it.
